kw.doc: Opens a new application to given Appium server. kw.doc: Launch application. Application can be launched while Appium session running. This keyword can be used to launch application during test case or between test cases.

kw.name: Open Browser
kw.doc: Opens a new browser instance. Use this keyword for quick experiments or debugging sessions. Use `New Page` directly instead of `Open Browser` for production and automated execution. See `Browser, Context and Page` for more information about Browser and related concepts.
kw.msg: Open Browser is for quick experimentation and debugging only. Use New Page for production.

{"acceptDownloads": false, "ignoreHTTPSErrors": false, "bypassCSP": false, "deviceScaleFactor": 1.0, "isMobile": false, "hasTouch": false, "javaScriptEnabled": true, "offline": false, "hideRfBrowser": false}

Successfully created context with options: {"acceptDownloads": false, "ignoreHTTPSErrors": false, "bypassCSP": false, "deviceScaleFactor": 1, "isMobile": false, "hasTouch": false, "javaScriptEnabled": true, "offline": false, "hideRfBrowser": false}

kw.name: Get Title
kw.doc: Returns the title of the current page.

kw.name: Fill Text
kw.doc: Clears and fills the given ``text`` into the text field found by ``selector``.
kw.msg: Fills the text 'testadonis' in the given field.

kw.name: Click
kw.doc: Simulates mouse click on the element found by ``selector``.

kw.name: Quit Application
kw.doc: Quit application. Application can be quit while Appium session is kept alive. This keyword can be used to close application during test case or between test cases.

kw.name: Close Application
kw.doc: Closes the current application and also close webdriver session.

kw.name: Wait Until Page Contains Element
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` appears on current page.

kw.name: Wait Until Keyword Succeeds
kw.doc: Runs the specified keyword and retries if it fails.

kw.name: Wait Until Page Contains Element

kw.doc: Runs the specified keyword and retries if it fails.

kw.name: Input Text
kw.doc: Types the given `text` into text field identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Wait Until Page Contains Element
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` appears on current page.

kw.name: Click Element
kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Wait Until Page Contains Element
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` appears on current page.

kw.name: Click Element
kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Wait Until Page Contains Element
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` appears on current page.

kw.name: Click Element
kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Quit Application
kw.doc: Quit application. Application can be quit while Appium session is kept alive. This keyword can be used to close application during test case or between test cases.

kw.name: Close Application
kw.doc: Closes the current application and also close webdriver session.

suite.doc: A test case for user should be able to check the balance

suite.name: Sign Up

test.name: Login test case

kw.name: Open Application
kw.doc: Opens a new application to given Appium server. Capabilities of appium server, Android and iOS, Please check https://github.com/appium/appium/blob/master/docs/en/writing-running-appium/server-args.md | *Option* | *Man.* | *Description* | | remote_url | Yes | Appium server url | | alias | no | alias |

kw.name: Sleep
kw.doc: Pauses the test executed for the given time.

kw.name: Scroll
kw.doc: Scrolls from one element to another Key attributes for arbitrary elements are `id` and `name`. See `introduction` for details about locating elements.

kw.name: Capture Page Screenshot
kw.doc: Takes a screenshot of the current page and embeds it into the log.
